title: Please make the champion sales affect IP as well.
body: Buying runes and champion take so much IP already. Would be nice to get 50% off champions in IP as well and not just RP.

replies.body: riot is greedy, why the hell would they do that?

Hey now, I don't get free Subway sandwiches all the time just by accumulating hours of videogaming.

Riot is a company, they have to pay employees (omg right?) and make a profit, the fact that we can **earn** things instead of spending money is generous as is.

Nobody is being forced to spend a single cent, period.
Pay? Just pay them with RP :^)
People who spend money do have an advantage though

Only on a select few skins does it help, such as I believe iBlitzcrank and some others.
You are a fraction correct though!

That skin to win nonsense is just an urban legend. I mean it's not like there's ever been a [gamebreaking bug](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bwUo2JGlX64) that could only be accessed by buying a skin or something.
The cause of that bug seems to be the brand dying reset the bounce counter rather than the skin, unless you weren't actually being sarcastic.

Nah it was the skin causing it. They took it off the store and disabled Brand while they hotfixed it and everything.
The funniest part is that the bug was found and reported on the PBE, but they still shipped the skin to live before they did anything about the bug. The ordeal was shady as fuck since it was specifically Zombie Brand only that had the issue, and it was allowed to run rampant on live for an entire day before it was acknowledged.

Depends on if you're playing competitively or casually. The benefits from paying for rune pages and whatever else isn't too worth it if you're a casual player, but nearly mandatory if you're a hardcore competitive player.

But that's true for most sports out there.

I mean, do you think basketball jerseys and volleyball knee/elbow pads are free?

SO yes, you're not being forced to pay a cent even if you're competitive, but it does give a competitive advantage. Again, Rito is a company who makes money, so of **course** there's benefits to cashing out a little $$$.

I mean, how old are you? Do you enjoy working for free or something, or do you want people to pay you?
Since when does basketball jerseys give you an advantage. Also you usually never have to pay for a basketball jersey on a team.

The point is you often have to invest in sports equipment, particularly if you're playing at a competitive high school/college level. I'm almost certain there's equipment fees unless things have changed in the past couple years.

You're kind of avoiding my point here. Do you, or do you not, spend money on real life sports equipment?
It's a free game. How is that greedy?

I had this thought when I first started playing, but the intended purpose of the champion sales is to get people to buy them with RP, so this would pretty much defeat the purpose of that. Why buy them with RP when you can get a 6300 champ for a mere 3150?
With Hextech Crafting it's possible to get 6300 champs for 1700-5100 IP.

This is what I did to get all of the 6300 champions at a discount.
I bought every champion up to 4800, then for 6300s I rr'd champion shards.
What about getting champs you don't like and would never play? Once that champ is in your inventory it becomes a target for mystery gifts.
Thanks for the tip. I'm quite far away from owning all non 6300 champs, but I'll keep this in mind.

What about a mere 10% off?
6300->5670 (-630)
4800->4320 (-480)
3150->2835 (-315)
1350->1215 (-135)
450->405 (-45)

Creates a minor boost, and it's not that bad at the higher stages.

Anyone who thinks theres a chance of this happening is really stupid. Riot is a business and like every business they need money to survive. If they made sales on IP then thatd be even less RP that people would buy. Their are some who only spend RP on skins but there are others who spend RP on champs and if they made champs IP go on sale that would be less RP that people buy, and those numbers would add up.

You are getting a free game. Of course they are going to do stuff to encourage you to spend money on RP every single free game does that, but you dont have to spend a dime. You can get every single content in this game 100% free(even skins through crafting now). Like seriously they even made skins free to get now through crafting, the one thing you could never buy with IP and they made it free to get, and your still complaining? What do you think would happen if riot handed everything to you? They would get far less money and be a far smaller company right now.

Why do you think WoW is so big? Cause they are pay to play and get the money to keep shoving out new content and focusing on every aspect of their game. You are getting a free game, stop crying cause they need to make money. Whats next you going to cry about paying bills too? People need money to survive. Deal with it.

People aren't likely to buy champs with rp though.
However, if they actually have rp, they would be more likely to spend it on skins for champions they own. Owning more champions gives that player more opprotinities to purchase skins or chromas with their RP.


As an analogy:
Gillette would give away free razors. People who liked it would then buy more or replacement heads/blades. Those peoe were unlikely to buy those razors in the first place though.


Your argument is not completely valid.

"People aren't likely to buy champs with rp though."
Why not? Like, I seriously don't get where you're coming from. If I can spend a marginal amount of money to save myself a significant amount of time, the money to effort quotient is more than enough to be justified.

Because the game is free-to-play. Not everyone has the money nor the desire to buy champs with RP when they want them. The analogy he brings up is great and I can say that it applies to me. I am very unlikely to buy a new champ with RP, however, I spend RP on new skins quite frequently. Riot would benefit in the long run by offering reduced champ IP prices. People would have more champs to buy skins for.

"Champion bundles"
Best of both worlds.

Actually a thing already. . . Kinda.
Every time a champion is released, the oldest 6300 IP champ gets the cost reduced. Every 5(?), 2 <6300 cost champions also get reduced.
Every 3. It's better than 5. :D

Know its already a thing, just some of those that haven't been gotten to yet really could use the price drop because not only are they not new, they aren't even remotely meta. Poor broken Aatrox for example likely won't see a price drop for two and a half years, quite likely to eat a rework before it rolls around.

Is it really okay for stuff to be at the upper price point for an average of *five* years with the current rate of champion releases?
I can see why riot wouldn't go through with this but it would be nice
You are literally complaining that this free-to-play game isn't free enough. Kindly stop.

Honestly, I disagree. Riot needs to make money aswell to run servers and everything. If you're not using money on them, consider yourself lucky to be able to play this game at all, much less buy champions to your liking. The facts are: They need money, and they aren't forcing anyone to pay anything. Taking 50% of IP purchases would make people not want to buy RP since you can't turn RP into IP. Those are the facts
